_header: Luke in his lesson leres to me
Subjects: evangelists, four; Virgin Mary, Annunciation to
_description: Verses on the Four Evangelists — twenty-six 6-line stanzas with an ‘O and I’ refrain

BodRawPoe175.First Lines:
Luke in his lesson leres to meHow gabryel was graythed in gracyus
                    degre…
BodRawPoe175.Last Lines:
…With ane O and ane I w[ ]His ioy [ ] full of grace graythed [
                    ]
BodRawPoe175.Note: Partly unreadable because very faded and worn.
BodRawPoe175.Editions:
Heuser,  Wilhelm. 
             “With an O and an I.” 
             Anglia
         27 (1904): 283-319: 185-9.

BLAdd45896.First Lines:
Luce In hys lessoun lerede me to syngeand specud a speche þat
                    spedi was to springe…
BLAdd45896.Last Lines:
…to me be hyt Idon at his oune willeal þat gabriel hast
                    talked me tilleWit an o and an I þes þey hauen
                    wroustþat marie by Caste wit a child þat hos alle had
                    Soust
BLAdd45896.Editions:
Smith,  A. H. 
             “The Middle English Lyrics in Additional MS 45896.” 
             London Medieval Studies
         2, Part (1951): 33-49: 45-7.
